text:
[Section: Page 414 of 1048]



The irreparable harm done over the last seven weeks is devastating. It has literally torn the Moyer family apart and cast reputations asunder. Just think
about if we had done this the next day, instead of now, given the result and recommendations. There is a lesson to be learned.
"Justice delayed is justice denied" and we both got the justice we wanted so would you like to discuss next steps, or should I assume we are back into
the plan as recommended as a stopgap till the attorneys do their thing? Just let me know if you want to discuss here or by phone.
We both have crazy bitterness for the way this transpired, festered, and destroyed us as a family, just to end up here. Even though she was crazy hard
on me today, it is clear that if nothing changed except for fostering hate and distrust for a month and a half, we missed the mark.
Given we are both parents forever (co? parallel? fuck all?) to our kids, I hope we refer to her thoughtful words as we make decisions and consider their
best interests moving forward. What a total fucked up goat rodeo this was and the relationships it destroyed for me, are very real.
Please let me know if you are going to make time. I assure you I'll be peaceful and constructive.
-robert
Message 1578 of 4024
You know we got Dr. Brown’s parenting plan back yesterday. Afterwards you checked out and I assume I won’t hear back from you till you get
around to it in the morning. You can make up any excuse that you want, but you got exactly what you asked for and now you’re kind of being a bit of
a weenie. Just like when she told us last Saturday that I could see Adrian and it took you days to get back to me.
You can pretend like you don’t know what you’re doing but no one would buy it. It didn’t serve you well this time and it’s not gonna serve you well
next time. At some point, you actually have to put the children first as Dr Brown or the next court appointed facilitator will do and quit thinking of
yourself. Obviously, I’m documenting a consistent pattern going back to October for one thing or another.
I’ve always had 50-50 custody of our kids but you block me at every move from seeing them since it is not “on strategy” with Anna Lisa as you told
Debbie and she reminded me of. Even when I’ve done every thing you asked- blow test, meetings, dna analysis (not your bullshit hair test) your
freaking RO, that says I credibly will beat my kids.wtf is that?
At some point an adult will seethis Christine. One did yesterday. The difference next time is that you will have a proven track record of obstructionist
bullshit to go along with it to reinforce you are a shitty mom who is focusing on deflecting blame. Just like you did for blowing up our family, or
being inappropriate with Kevin Otero and lying about it.
I wish I could respect your journey and feel like it had some merit, even if misguided. But it does not. You lie, cheat, and blame everyone but yourself.
I actually feel bad for you. It’s a sign of someone who can’t cope with their own actions and needs it to be someone else’s fault. Always. Always.
Always. The reason you hate me, is I call it out.
Good luck with that! Hope he makes you feel better about yourself and tells you that you are always right.

To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: Never)
Subject:Just another day with V little
Message 1579 of 4024
Just re-read Dr Brown’s note. It’s clear I let the emotions I feel due to your intentional inaction get the best of me. Going after you for continuing
your pattern is neither constructive nor useful. History shows that. Please accept my sincere apologies. I am hopeful you will tune in at some point
and take her words as seriously as I am now. I’m sorry, Christine.

He FaceTimed me to ask when we could get together and see the house this AM. I told him this is the plan:
- Team pictures- I think 10:30
- Break- give him some gifts
- Game- he likely can’t play
- House- visit and give shoes
- Con- head over for sneakers
He reached out to me on his walk where he felt safe and let me know he really wants to see me today.
I hope that’s not a problem and we begin the plan today, just like we did last time- the very next day.
When we see each other AD comes first. I will be kind and appreciate you for 29 years as my soulmate.

Subject:Re: Today
Message 1607 of 4024
We owe it to both our kids to be able to have frank discussions about them at this point in their lives. Today was a blast. Amazing. And thank you so
much for letting me do sneaker con. That meant a lot to both of us.
But also, I noticed a lot of social anxiety and behaviors in him that I would like to be able to openly discuss with you. You can blame it on me, but will
never know if that’s really the issue and you can’t blame everything bad on me without giving me credit for some of the good.
But either way, till they are out of our house, you and I owe it to them to be able to have a dialogue in their best interest. We are the parents . We
should be working as a team together regardless of how we feel about each other, we should unite in their best interest.
We really need to start getting over ourselves or at least compartmentalized to the point where we can do them justice in their childhood. I think after
all that was the point of you doing all of this. So if we can stop blaming each other and start putting them first, I will work constructively with you on
that.
But we both have to do it together babe. Let’s try!
Sent:02/24/2024 at 08:13 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/24/2024 at 08:24 PM)
Subject:Adrian

I got a text message that Amex account payment is past due. It is not my card so I assume it’s yours which I do not have access to.

Subject:Amex

Message 1609 of 4024
Thank options for the heads up.
It’s honestly hard to know what you quit doing for us. Nothing changed wrt what I have done.
I said I did not know what would start falling through the cracks, but it is playing out exactly as I said.
You always paid the bills. Always. I made sure to sell at the best possible price. I still do that for us.
We have no way to plan our finances or our future. You just quit and got an RO. It’s all going to hell.
Sent:02/24/2024 at 08:38 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 06:56 AM)
Subject:Re: Amex
Message 1610 of 4024
With your support, Adrian and I were back in our groove pretty quickly. We talked, a lot, about a wide range of things. His face was lit. He was
excited. He could barely talk fast enough at times. He asked deep questions. From technical stuff to life stuff. We sat at the dinner table together and
enjoyed dinner and each other’s company.
None of it would be possible without your blessing. You had one very happy little man yesterday. And his Daddy was pretty damn pleased himself! I
always called you “super mom”when we were the Moyer family, and yesterday you totally earned the crown again! It was awesome!
I’d love to hear if he likes his place. I want Max and AD to have fun in the “boys getaway” I tried to make for them. I hope it’s a good place for sleep
overs. That was the intent. Especially for Max and Parker. It’s built with their summer jam in mind. Mom’s support would mean the world to us.
Thanks for everything!
Sent:02/25/2024 at 02:44 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 06:56 AM)
Subject:Yesterday
Message 1611 of 4024
You cut me off from the account in your name in fidelity even though it is community property so I have no visibility or access to balances and what
you are doing.
You also made it clear in an email months ago that accessing your accounts in your name was invading your privacy so I never logged back into the
Amex in your name. . I told you last time a payment was declined on your Amex I stopped logging in so I have no visibility if and when a payment is
due.
I also just got a notice that 500 cash was transferred from the joint Bank of America account to an Apple Pay account. I assume that was you.
You have access to cash and have some control over assets in fidelity account so how you move or manage money around, I have no idea.
Sent:02/25/2024 at 09:52 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 09:52 AM)
Subject:Re: Amex

Message 1612 of 4024
Thanks for the helpful explanation.
Fidelity- what did I cut off? You never had access is what I understood. Please let me know.
AMEX- it’s like the phone or Xfinity right? I don’t care. Big deal. We are married. I did not know you just quit paying the bill. And I asked you to tell
me if so. Can you please resume that until we are final?
Apple Cash- yes, of course. The Sneaker Con had no internet. And no way to pay for things other than that. So AD got two pairs of shoes, and a T-
shirt he really wanted. I hope that is not an issue. See attached.
Fidelity Account- yes, I do have access and I can pay from there but it’s not set up to, I would need yet another account for that. It won’t do bill pay.
We agreed nothing would change. But you did. I even have $20k in review from a transfer I sent Friday so we would continue to operate as we had
agreed.
This is the only way to communicate you allow. So we will continue to find out what you are not doing after the fact, while I continue what I said I
would do.
Even this exchange should have cost us 1k for our attorneys to do over a month because Anna Lisa is slow and imprecise. You know that by now.
If this explanation is simply too long for you to understand, it’s unfortunate. Details matter. I’m trying to work with, especially during our test week.
This does not, and has never worked for us.

If you want me to access that again please share password

Sent:02/25/2024 at 10:30 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 10:38 AM)
Subject:Re: Amex

Message 1615 of 4024
So.... I don’t want to inflame things. That is not my intention. Especially during our “prove it week”
As you will see however, almost a month ago I brought up suggestions to improve both our working relationship and co-parenting effectiveness.
You said:
Let Anna Lisa know that I don’t beat my kids and you saying it is probably inappropriate. Seems like she, as your lawyer, would tell you that too, but
whatever.
I should propose a more appropriate form of communication to help us, but be cognizant of your sincere and justified concerns. So I did in detail.
We were on path to improve everything for a full week until you met with Anna Lisa and it went “poof” up in smoke. No change whatsoever. Back to
this.
The next week we were doing well, but you asked for patience daily and even thanked me for affording you that. Till the next Friday again. And then
“Poof”
You get mad that my frustration manifests here. I am letting you know when you say “yes” and actions show “no” it makes things worse for this
situation.
You say “you have to prove it first” while you poke me week after week. And get upset by my response to your contradictory behavior. It’s super
frustrating.
So despite you agreeing and then ignoring exactly what you asked me to do, I’m going to try one last time to break our catch-22 and make progress.
I’d like to share my thoughts ahead of time in an effort to take this back and as Dr Brown loosely said, “agree to disagree, quit fighting, and focus on
the future.”
Every mental health professional has had awful, awful thoughts on divorce lawyers. Can you and I hammer out what “WE” believe is best for our kids
here?
I’ll share, please block 10 minutes this weekend to review. And let me know how we move it forward.
Best
- robert

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 10:40 AM)

repeating things that stir emotions.

with negative innuendo.
The inquiry still stands and I’d like to hear what you think. But please accept my apologies as I am trying to be less passive aggressive and snarky. That
will never be helpful.

Sent:02/25/2024 at 07:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 08:39 PM)
Subject:Re: Domestic Abuse

So you get busy now till the end of the week. I’ll get really frustrated when you don’t find time, so I’m just gonna propose something that I’m gonna
send to Lisa. But I would like your approval at least for Phase II
Note this is the fourth time I’ve had to type this up. I am really frustrated with OFW.  It fucking sucks.
I would like to propose amendments to the restraining order in a phased approach. They include all the standard language about civility, decency, and
kindness applying to topics around the kids and/or our fiscal situation. No change to that part.
Proposal to assure your concerns are met:

Phase I - now we try to do everything here, it sucks
Phase II - next RO, allow emergency/urgent OFW calls
Phase III - use OFW for documentation purposes
- Email
Phase I - now I am a bystander not a participant
Phase II - next RO, allow forwarding of fyi emails
Phase III- tbd? allow for inline/normal emails
- Text
Phase I - now, nothing allowed
Phase II - I’d like emergency/urgent texts
Phase III - tbd? return to normal text communication
- Calls
Phase I - now, nothing allowed
Phase II - I’d like emergency/urgent calls
Phase III - tbd? return to normal text communication
Ideally, we can agree that we could move forward with Phase II suggestions, if we both agree, via an email from Lisa to Annalisa on Monday. Then
when she fixes the wrong RO she can make the change one time.
Just like we were doing with Dr. Brown, if we do not adhere to the guidelines provided we revert back to the prior phase. This will incentivize us to
both make it work and be constructive and helpful moving forward.
Whatever you do, I am asking you please to take the 10 minutes we spoke of earlier today, spend it on this,
think about it, and let me know. I hope this is a reasonable compromise that you feel good about.
Please give me a call for 5 min if you have concerns.
Thanks!
Message 1626 of 4024
Thank you for outlining below.
I am extremely concerned and have been advised against texts and calls given the demonstrated history of harassment, anger and bullying, for topics
that are unrelated to parenting. This was not just my lawyer but Dr. Brown as well.
Sent:02/25/2024 at 08:51 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/25/2024 at 08:56 PM)
Subject:Re: Domestic Abuse

Dr Brown was clear that in her opinion OFW should be the forum we use given the history. I am open to OFW calls for emergencies.
One week is not long enough to show a demonstrated ability to address my concerns and real fears for safety. You have continued to downplay the
impact 25 years of aggression and coercion has had on me. Even in person the level of aggression and anger is palpable.
Not having texts/calls have been such a huge relief to me.
The emails with 3rd party and fyi make sense to me.
I also need to address the pictures you brought up. The language you used to highlight you had them was scary and threatening to me. The specificity
of referencing details in the pictures was shocking, to drive home the point. It was the same type of language you used with the boys. It’s alarming and
used to scare. I do not believe they have been destroyed and fear they will be used as retribution in the future.
